content.description: Start with your left Â hand on a crimp in the bottom middle of the face and your right hand around the right arete on a good edge. You can use a big slab that is flat with the ground but still part of the boulder. From here you work your way up to a jug that you do a small jump to the big block poking out of the right side.
content.location: About half mile into the canyon after a line of placed rocks that cross the trail. If you are hiking up the canyon it will be on your left. It is very visible from the trail. Look for a rock that has a flat overhanging by a bigger boulder poking out from the tops of the trees (blue skies on rainy days boulder). Finally the boulder is about 100 feet left (facing up the canyon) off the trail.
